editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust.

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus beati Gregorii (. .) librum xla. Omeliarum Euangelij et cetera
msItem.incipit: Reuerendissimo et sanctissimo fratri secundino episcopo Gregorius seruus seruorum dei Inter sacra missarum solennia his que diebus festis
msItem.rubric: [fol. 1v, the text] Leccio sancti euangelij secundum lucam
msItem.incipit: [fol. 2] In illo tempore dixit iesus discipulis suis
msItem.rubric: Omelia leccionis eiusdem habita ad populum in basilica beau petri apostoli
msItem.incipit: Dominus ac redemptor noster paratos nos inuenire desiderans senescentem mundum
msItem.explicit: deus que per me in uestris auribus loquitur per se mentibus loquatur Qui uiuit et regnat [form ending] Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber beati GREGORII summi pontificis Omelie Sancti GREGORII pape
msItem.author: Gregory the Great
msItem.title: Homilies on the Gospels
msItem.note: CPL 1711, ed. PL 76:1075 – 1312. A table for the homilies in double columns, fol. 1rv. Fol. 111v is blank but ruled, as is the rear pastedown.

supportDesc.extent:
ii + 112 (numbered to 111; the final leaf is the current rear pastedown). 240 160
165–170 112

collation.signatures: Signatures survive only in quire 5 and some leaves of 13, both roman and arabic numbers on leaves in the first half of the quire.
collation.catchwords: Catchwords, towards the gutter and boxed, sometimes with red; a few catchwords link leaves within quires.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 30–36 to the page. Prickings; bounded and ruled in black ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in anglicana formata, by at least three scribes: the stints run fols. 1 – 8v, fols. 9 – 58v, fols. 59 – 111. Punctuation by point and punctus elevatus (scribe i); to these, scribe 2 adds the punctus interrogativus; by point and occasional punctus elevatus and virgula (scribe 3).

decoDesc.decoNote: Two-line blue lombards on red flourishing at the beginning of each sermon.
Within sermons, red-slashed capitals to divide the text.
To fol. 30, the homily number is provided in the upper corner of rectos.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. Pastedowns are medieval vellum, a College bookplate on the front pastedown, the rear one a ruled waste sheet from the MS, its original final leaf. The front pastedown has holes and verdigris stains, probably from a chain-staple in Watson’s position 6. At the front, two medieval vellum flyleaves; no extra leaves at the rear.

provenance.p: A table of the forty homilies (fol. ii, secretary, s. xv med.).
‘Precium libri xiij. s iiij. d’ (fol. 111v, s. xv); another contemporary pen-trial on the rear pastedown.
Given by John White, listed in the Benefactors’ Book (col. ii) as ‘Gregorij homiliae in Euangeliae MS’.

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.
